body_html: Seems a bug, but if I understand well, torch.from_numpy should be used for conversion (at least currently), because the constructor would treat their input as a generic sequence and will iterate over it (which is inefficient and will hurt except for really small tensors).
body_text: Seems a bug, but if I understand well, torch.from_numpy should be used for conversion (at least currently), because the constructor would treat their input as a generic sequence and will iterate over it (which is inefficient and will hurt except for really small tensors).
body: Seems a bug, but if I understand well, `torch.from_numpy` should be used for conversion (at least currently), because the constructor would treat their input as a generic sequence and will iterate over it (which is inefficient and will hurt except for really small tensors).
